title: First U.S. Lunar Lander in More than 50 Years On Its Way
summary: Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander is on its way to the Moon. Liftoff of the United Launch Alliance’s new Vulcan-Centaur rocket went perfectly early this morning. Built through a Public-Private Partnership […]

title: Vulcan Centaur launches Peregrine lunar lander on inaugural mission
summary: United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur soared into night skies on its long-awaited first launch Jan. 8, carrying a commercial lunar lander.

title: The Exploration Company Begins CNES Backed Rocket Engine Development
summary:
The Exploration Company has begun work on a reusable methane-powered staged combustion rocket engine that will be capable of producing approximately 200 tonnes of thrust. The endeavour is being co-financed by the French space agency CNES. Founded in 2021, The Exploration Company has been developing a modular, reusable spacecraft called Nyx. The company is expected […]

title: Vulcan successfully launches Peregrine lunar lander on inaugural flight
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) has done its part in returning the US to the Moon with the launch of Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander atop its brand-new Vulcan Centaur rocket.

title: UAE Will Build Airlock for Artemis Gateway Lunar Space Station
summary: NASA announced this morning that the United Arab Emirates is joining the Artemis campaign to return astronauts to the Moon. The UAE will provide an airlock for the Gateway space […]

title: United Arab Emirates to Build Gateway Airlock
summary: NASA and the Mohammed bin Rashid Space Centre (MBRSC) of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) announced Sunday plans for the space centre to provide an airlock for Gateway, humanity’s first space station outside of Low Earth Orbit. The lunar space station, positioned in a Near Rectilinear Halo Orbit, will support NASA’s missions for long-term exploration of the Moon under Artemis as part of NASA’s Moon to Mars initiative.

title: UAE to build airlock for lunar Gateway
summary: The United Arab Emirates has agreed to develop an airlock module for the lunar Gateway, helping complete the design of the lunar space station while enhancing the UAE’s role in the Artemis lunar exploration effort.

title: NASA and SDA optical campaigns could share terminals
summary: NASA will determine whether the commercial terminals the Space Development Agency is adopting for satellite-to-satellite communications can also transmit data to Earth.
